properties.headline: Flood Watch issued January 9 at 10:44AM CST until January 14 at 4:30PM CST by NWS Quad Cities IA IL
properties.description:
...The National Weather Service in the Quad Cities has issued a
Flood Watch for the following rivers in Illinois...

La Moine River at Colmar affecting Hancock and McDonough Counties


At this time there is limited confidence associated with rainfall
amounts and the location of predicted rainfall. In addition, some
of the rainfall may freeze up, and therefore not get into the river
system.

If rainfall actually getting into the basin is less than predicted,
the forecast river stage may not be reached. Conversely, if rainfall
getting into the river basin is more than predicted the river may
crest higher.

As the forecast becomes more certain, this watch will either be
upgraded to a warning or cancelled.

The National Weather Service in Quad Cities has issued a
* Flood Watch for
The La Moine River at Colmar
* Until Monday evening.
* At  9:45 AM Thursday the stage was 5.6 feet.
* Flood stage is 20.0 feet.
* Minor flooding is possible.
* Forecast, rise above flood stage Sunday morning, and continue
rising to 21.5 feet late Sunday night.
* This forecast is based on forecast rainfall getting into the
river system. Consequently, there is limited confidence in
the river reaching flood stage.
